content.description: Stand Start on two underclings just right of Dynamite and dyno to the lip of the boulder and top out. This one move problem can be impossible or easy depending on your biceps and power undercling ability. Has been done static and all points off.
content.protection: boulder pad and maybe a spotter

content.description: The route to do on this boulder. Start at the base of the prow on a left hand jug and a right hand edge. Crux move up to another great incut and then out to the jug at the end of the overhang. Climb up the prow on crimps and top out. If boulder problems can have exposure this top out has it, because you top out at the end of a knife blade prow!
content.protection: Boulder pads and maybe a spotter for the top out.

content.description: Start as for Tick Tick Boom but after the first move go left onto the face and follow crimps to the top utilizing a key heel hook. The final toss to the lip should not be taken lightly, as it has spit off many who have tried the problem and may be the crux. If you stay on the right side of the face its around V6, and if you cross over more left its more like V7, most people have done the V6 version lately.
content.protection: Boulder pads and a spotter for the final toss to the lip.

content.description: A singular problem on a boulder that looks at the explosive boulder. Sit start on the left arete of the boulder. Be careful not to fall into the pit and climb up the arete and make a big move to a jug before topping out.
content.location: When looking at the long face of the Explosive boulder turn to your left and walk 20 feet to the slight overhanging boulder that faces you. This climb starts on the left arete not quite in the pit.

content.description: Start as for Tick Tick Boom but once at the jug on the prow follow the ever tightening seam right and finally up slopers to the easy topout. A direct start has been done going from the crimp and a sidepull straight into the seam, without changing the grade.
Sit start for Dynamite using a miserable crimp. Pull up past several intermediate crimps using some trickery to the start of Dynamite and tossing to the lip.
Start on the two best crimps at head height on the left side of the boulder and go to the lip and a slightly tricky mantle. Another one move problem like Lava Lunge but slightly easier.
